original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid /
translated: The characteristic of emptiness

original: dmigs pa med pas rnam dben nyid //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pas rnam dben nyid //
translated: is the absence of an objective support.

original: ces bya ba ni dngos po ma dmigs pas dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dngos po ma dmigs pas dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no conceptualization that has the sign of an entity due to the non-apprehension of an entity.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis dben pa ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis dben pa ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The absence of all conceptualization is the characteristic of emptiness.

original: mtshan ma med pa zhi nyid de //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa zhi nyid de //
translated: The signless is peace.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ma dmigs pa'i sgo nas sems la rnam 'gyur med pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ma dmigs pa'i sgo nas sems la rnam 'gyur med pas so //
translated: This is because there is no change in the mind due to the non-apprehension of the sign of the factors of enlightenment and so forth.

original: gsum pa'i mtshan nyid sdug bsngal dang gti mug med ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang gti mug med pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa'i mtshan nyid sdug bsngal dang gti mug med ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang gti mug med pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of the third is the absence of suffering and delusion.

original: shes rab kyi sgo nas smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin skyes pas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi sgo nas smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin skyes pas so //
translated: This is because the meditative stabilization of the absence of expectancy arises through the door of wisdom.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩrnam par thar pa'i sgo zhes bya ba @297a * //
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir / rnam par thar pa'i sgo zhes bya ba @297a * //
translated: In order to teach that,

original: la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe door of liberation,‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'du byed sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid can rnams la yang dag par rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa gsum gyis 'du byed rnams sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid can du lta zhing ngo //
analyzed: 'du byed sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid can rnams la yang dag par rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa gsum gyis 'du byed rnams sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid can du lta zhing ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso, with regard to the nature of the suffering of conditioned existence‚Äù means that, conventionally, one views conditioned existence as having the nature of suffering through the three types of suffering, such as the suffering of suffering.

original: shes rab kyi 'du byed kyi 'du byed rang bzhin la lta ba na zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi stobs kyis 'du byed rnams rang bzhin med par lta ba na'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi 'du byed kyi 'du byed rang bzhin la lta ba na zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi stobs kyis 'du byed rnams rang bzhin med par lta ba na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen one views the nature of the formative forces of wisdom‚Äù means that, through the power of wisdom, one views the formative forces as lacking an intrinsic nature.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the characteristics of the eight liberations, he says:

original: rnam par thar pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The characteristics of the liberations, etc.

original: 'di rnams kyi sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba yin pas na rnam par thar pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam par grol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba yin pas na rnam par thar pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam par grol bar byed pa'o //
translated: Since one becomes liberated from the obscurations in regard to these, the characteristics of the liberations are that which brings about liberation.

original: rnam par thar pa rnams sngar ma gsungs pas rnam par thar pa brgyad bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams sngar ma gsungs pas rnam par thar pa brgyad bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the liberations were not previously mentioned, in order to teach the eight liberations, he says,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The eight liberations are:

original: de la sprul pa'i sgrib pa dang bral bas na rnam par thar pa dang po gnyis so //
analyzed: de la sprul pa'i sgrib pa dang bral bas na rnam par thar pa dang po gnyis so //
translated: The first two liberations are due to freedom from the obscurations of emanation.

original: sprul pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i rnam par grol bar byed pas na gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i rnam par grol bar byed pas na gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is due to liberation from the afflictions of emanation.

original: ro myang ba la rnam par grol bar byed pas na gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o //üîΩde la ro myang ba ni 'di ni bzhi pa'o ;
analyzed: ro myang ba la rnam par grol bar byed pas na gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o // de la ro myang ba ni 'di ni bzhi pa'o ;
translated: The fourth liberation of the formless realm is due to liberation from relishing.

original: /'di ni gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: /'di ni gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Relishing is thinking, this is the fourth, this is sublime, and so on.

original: de las rnam par grol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de las rnam par grol bar byed pa'o //
translated: Liberation from that is the fourth liberation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dag pa pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dag pa pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, it should be called pure.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar byed pas na brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar byed pas na brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is due to liberation from the obscurations of the cessation of discernment and feeling.

original: 'di rnams la bdun ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin can yin la /
analyzed: 'di rnams la bdun ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin can yin la /
translated: Seven of these are of the nature of concentration.

original: brgyad pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The eighth is of the nature of the cessation of mind and mental activities.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin can 'di rnams kyi dmigs pa ni ming gi rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin can 'di rnams kyi dmigs pa ni ming gi rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
translated: The objects of these which are of the nature of concentration should be understood as being known by following the names.

original: brgyad pa la dmigs pa med de /
analyzed: brgyad pa la dmigs pa med de /
translated: The eighth has no object,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas so //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas so //
translated: because it is of the nature of the cessation of mind and mental activities.

original: 'di rnams ni mdor bsdu na lam gsum gyis bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni mdor bsdu na lam gsum gyis bsdus pa yin te /
translated: These are included in three paths in brief:

original: sprul pa'i lam dang / sprul pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i lam dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: sprul pa'i lam dang / sprul pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i lam dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam mo //
translated: the path of emanation, the path of the antidote to the defilement of emanation, and the path of ease in this life.

original: de la sprul pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sprul pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The path of emanation is twofold:

original: bdag @297b nyid la gzugs med pa'i 'du shes mi sgom pa dang / sgom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag @297b nyid la gzugs med pa'i 'du shes mi sgom pa dang / sgom pa'o //
translated: not cultivating the perception of formlessness in oneself, and cultivating it.

original: de dag ni rim pa bzhin du dang po gnyis so //
analyzed: de dag ni rim pa bzhin du dang po gnyis so //
translated: These are the first two, respectively.

original: sprul pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sprul pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Emanation has two types of antidotes to the afflictions:

original: sdug pa'i gzugs sprul pa la rtsol ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po dang / mi sdug pa'i gzugs sprul pa'i mi mthun pa'i gnyen po'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i gzugs sprul pa la rtsol ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po dang / mi sdug pa'i gzugs sprul pa'i mi mthun pa'i gnyen po'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: the antidote to the obscuration that is the effort to emanate a pleasant form, and the antidote to the obscuration that is the unpleasant form that is emanated.

original: de yang gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang gsum pa yin te /
translated: This is the third,

original: gnyi ga'i gnyen po yin pas so //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i gnyen po yin pas so //
translated: because it is the antidote to both.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i lam la yang gnyis te /
translated: The path of abiding happily in this life also has two types:

original: zhi bar gnas pa'i lam dang / thar pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: zhi bar gnas pa'i lam dang / thar pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas pa'i lam mo //
translated: the path of abiding in peace and the path of abiding in accordance with liberation.

original: de la dang po ni rnam par thar pa bzhi yin la /
analyzed: de la dang po ni rnam par thar pa bzhi yin la /
translated: The first is the four deliverances.

original: gnyis pa ni 'du shes tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'du shes tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: The second is the deliverance that is the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: brgyad po 'di rnams kyi nang nas dang po dang gnyis pa'i las ni sprul pa mngon par sprul par byed pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad po 'di rnams kyi nang nas dang po dang gnyis pa'i las ni sprul pa mngon par sprul par byed pa'o //
translated: From among these eight, the first two have the function of emanating emanations.

original: gsum pa'i las ni sdug pa sprul pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa'i las ni sdug pa sprul pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: The third has the function of being unafflicted with regard to emanating pleasant forms.

original: bzhi pa'i las ni zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa'i ro myang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i las ni zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa'i ro myang ba med pa'o //
translated: The function of the fourth is to not savor the taste of liberation as peace.

original: brgyad pa'i las ni mchog tu zhi ba'i 'phags pa'i gnas pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa'i las ni mchog tu zhi ba'i 'phags pa'i gnas pas gnas pa'o //
translated: The function of the eighth is to abide in the state of supreme peace, the ƒÅrya state.

original: 'di ni rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi dag gi don to //üîΩtshig gi don ni bsam gtan la brten nas rang gi bdag nyid la gzugs med pa la brten te gzugs med pa'i 'du shes mi sgom pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi dag gi don to // tshig gi don ni bsam gtan la brten nas rang gi bdag nyid la gzugs med pa la brten te gzugs med pa'i 'du shes mi sgom pa'am /
translated: This is the meaning of the eight liberations.üîΩThe meaning of the terms: based on the absorptions, one does not cultivate formless perception in dependence on the formless realm, or one manifests the perception of form and perceives external forms with the perception of internal form.

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes mngon du byas nas nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la kha dog sdug pa dang mi sdug par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes mngon du byas nas nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la kha dog sdug pa dang mi sdug par lta ba yin te /
translated: One sees beautiful and ugly colors in external forms.

original: rim pa bzhin du bying ba rgod pa zhi bar bya ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du bying ba rgod pa zhi bar bya ba'i don du ste /
translated: This is for the purpose of pacifying laxity and excitement in order,

original: de la mi sdug pa bsgoms pas sems kyi rgyun bying bar mthong na kha dog mi sdug par lta la /
analyzed: de la mi sdug pa bsgoms pas sems kyi rgyun bying bar mthong na kha dog mi sdug par lta la /
translated: because if one sees that the continuum of mind is lax due to cultivating repulsiveness, one should look at an ugly color.

original: kha dog sdug par bsgoms pas sems kyi rgyud rgod par mthong na kha dog mi sdug pa la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kha dog sdug par bsgoms pas sems kyi rgyud rgod par mthong na kha dog mi sdug pa la blta bar bya'o //
translated: If, by meditating on a beautiful color, one sees that the mind is agitated, one should look at an ugly color.

original: de la lta ba ni mos pas sprul pa rnams la yid kyis lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la lta ba ni mos pas sprul pa rnams la yid kyis lta ba'o //
translated: Looking at that is mentally looking at the emanations with interest.

original: nang gzugs su 'du mi byed pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la brten nas lta ba po'i rang bzhin ni bdag nyid la gzugs med pa'i 'du shes bsgoms pas sam gzugs med pa'i 'du shes mngon du byas
analyzed: nang gzugs su 'du mi byed pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la brten nas lta ba po'i rang bzhin ni bdag nyid la gzugs med pa'i 'du shes bsgoms pas sam gzugs med pa'i 'du shes mngon du byas
translated: Not forming inner materiality, etc. means that, based on the formless meditative attainments, the nature of the seer is one who meditates on the perception of formlessness or actualizes the perception of formlessness in oneself.

original: nas so // lhag ma ni sngar bzhin du'o //
analyzed: nas so // lhag ma ni sngar bzhin du'o //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: 'di dag gi khyad par ni nang gi bdag nyid la yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di dag gi khyad par ni nang gi bdag nyid la yin gyi /
translated: The difference between these is that they are in relation to oneself,

original: @298a * // phyi la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @298a * // phyi la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not to others.

original: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bdag nyid can gsum pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i gzugs so so la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes dang / phan tshun rjes su zhugs pa'i 'du shes dang / phan tshun ro gcig tu gyur pa'i 'du shes thob pas lta ba la gnas pas sa dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bdag nyid can gsum pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i gzugs so so la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes dang / phan tshun rjes su zhugs pa'i 'du shes dang / phan tshun ro gcig tu gyur pa'i 'du shes thob pas lta ba la gnas pas sa dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the concentration of the pure stages, which is based on the view, and which is attained by the perception of mutual dependence in regard to pleasant and unpleasant forms, by the perception of mutual inclusion, and by the perception of mutual identity.

original: de la sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dag la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes dang / phan tshun rjes su zhugs pa'i 'du shes la brten nas phan tshun ro gcig pa'i 'du shes thob par 'gyur te /üîΩ'di ltar gzugs sdug pa la ltos nas de las gzhan pa'i mi sdug pa'o zhes 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de la sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dag la phan tshun ltos pa'i 'du shes dang / phan tshun rjes su zhugs pa'i 'du shes la brten nas phan tshun ro gcig pa'i 'du shes thob par 'gyur te / 'di ltar gzugs sdug pa la ltos nas de las gzhan pa'i mi sdug pa'o zhes 'byung ba yin la /
translated: In this regard, the perception of mutual identity is attained on the basis of the perception of mutual dependence and the perception of mutual inclusion in regard to pleasant and unpleasant forms.üîΩThus, in dependence on a pleasant form, an unpleasant form is perceived as other than that.

original: mi sdug pa la ltos nas kyang sdug pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mi sdug pa la ltos nas kyang sdug pa yin gyi /
translated: In dependence on an unpleasant form, a pleasant form is perceived as other than that.

original: ma ltos par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma ltos par ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not perceived as other than that independently.

original: ci mthong ba la sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i blo mi skye bas so //üîΩde bzhin du sdug pa la mi sdug pa nyid rjes su zhugs pa yin la ;
analyzed: ci mthong ba la sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i blo mi skye bas so // de bzhin du sdug pa la mi sdug pa nyid rjes su zhugs pa yin la ;
translated: because the idea of the pleasant or unpleasant does not arise in regard to what is seen.üîΩIn the same way, the unpleasant is penetrated by the pleasant,

original: mi sdug pa la yang sdug pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: mi sdug pa la yang sdug pa nyid yin te /
translated: and the pleasant by the unpleasant.

original: sdug par 'dod pa'i skra la sogs pa yang mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sum cu rtsa drug gi nang du 'dus pas so //
analyzed: sdug par 'dod pa'i skra la sogs pa yang mi gtsang ba'i rdzas sum cu rtsa drug gi nang du 'dus pas so //
translated: Because the hair, etc., which are considered pleasant are included in the thirty-six impure substances.

original: de ltar phan tshun gzugs thams cad bsres nas sdug pa dang ro gcig pa'i 'du shes kyis lhag par mos par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar phan tshun gzugs thams cad bsres nas sdug pa dang ro gcig pa'i 'du shes kyis lhag par mos par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having mixed all forms with each other, he becomes absorbed in the notion that they are of one taste, i.e., pleasant.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, it is called the liberation of the pleasant.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gzugs la lhag par mos pa'i yang dag par 'byor ba thob pa de la sprul pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gzugs la lhag par mos pa'i yang dag par 'byor ba thob pa de la sprul pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: When he has attained mastery over the transformation of form as he desires, the defilement of creation is abandoned.

original: gzugs med pa bzhi ni zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas kyi dang / ci yang med pa'i dang / yod min med min skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa bzhi ni zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas kyi dang / ci yang med pa'i dang / yod min med min skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: The four formless states are the liberation of the sphere of infinite space, the liberation of the sphere of infinite consciousness, the liberation of the sphere of nothingness, and the liberation of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa ni rnam par thar pa dang rjes su mthun pa nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la gnas pa'i yang dag par 'byor pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa ni rnam par thar pa dang rjes su mthun pa nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la gnas pa'i yang dag par 'byor pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, the liberation of the sphere of infinite space is the concentration characterized by right attainment, which is in conformity with liberation and which is situated in the sphere of infinite space.

original: de bzhin du rnam shes mtha' yas pa la sogs pa 'di rnams kyang zag pa med pa dang rjes su mthun pa ni thar pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam shes mtha' yas pa la sogs pa 'di rnams kyang zag pa med pa dang rjes su mthun pa ni thar pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, these spheres of infinite consciousness and so on, which are in conformity with the uncontaminated, obtain the name of liberation,

original: de'i ro myang ba la rnam par thar par byed pas so //
analyzed: de'i ro myang ba la rnam par thar par byed pas so //
translated: because they liberate one from the taste of the contaminated.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba @298b 'gog pa ni zhes bya ba ni yod min med min gyi skye mched la brten nas zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa las 'das te /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba @298b 'gog pa ni zhes bya ba ni yod min med min gyi skye mched la brten nas zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa las 'das te /
translated: The cessation of ideation and sensation is the cessation of mind and mental factors, not the cessation of the body.

original: thar pa dang rjes su mthun par yang dag par 'byor pa 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'gog pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa dang rjes su mthun par yang dag par 'byor pa 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'gog pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The cessation of ideation and sensation is the cessation of mind and mental factors, not the cessation of the body.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad po 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad po 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: These eight liberations are called the noble abodes,

original: 'di dag gis 'phags pa rnams gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gis 'phags pa rnams gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the noble ones dwell in them.

original: de la 'phags pa dag ni gnas gnyis lan mang du gnas te /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa dag ni gnas gnyis lan mang du gnas te /
translated: The noble ones dwell frequently in two of these abodes,

original: gsum pa dang brgyad pas 'phags pa rnams phal cher gnas te mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa dang brgyad pas 'phags pa rnams phal cher gnas te mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis bskyod na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis bskyod na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúwhen stirred by the circle of wind.‚Äù

original: dpe bstan nas don dang sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe bstan nas don dang sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the example, in order to connect it with the meaning,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúO son of conqueror,‚Äù and so forth.

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs shin tu bsags pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs yongs su bsags pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving accumulated the collection of roots of virtue‚Äù refers to the accumulation of the collections of generosity and so forth.

original: theg pa chen po yang dag par sgrub pa la @313b mngon par 'dzegs pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam la theg pa chen po zhes bya la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po yang dag par sgrub pa la @313b mngon par 'dzegs pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam la theg pa chen po zhes bya la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving ascended to the correct practice of the Great Vehicle‚Äù means that the Great Vehicle is called the path of the bodhisattva who has attained the result.

original: de yang dag par sgrub pa ni thob pa yin la de'i don du mngon par 'dzegs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang dag par sgrub pa ni thob pa yin la de'i don du mngon par 'dzegs pa ste /
translated: Correct practice of that is attainment. For that purpose, one ascends to it,

original: der 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: der 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: one engages in it.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rgya mtshor phyin nas zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan ma med pa dang / rtsol ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyi spyod pa gang yin pa de nyid rgya mtsho yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rgya mtshor phyin nas zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan ma med pa dang / rtsol ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyi spyod pa gang yin pa de nyid rgya mtsho yin te /
translated: Having reached the ocean of the bodhisattva's practice, means having reached the very ocean which is the bodhisattvas' practice, the nature of which is signlessness and effortless activity.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can yin pas shin tu zab pa yin la de thob nas so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can yin pas shin tu zab pa yin la de thob nas so //
translated: Having attained that, means having attained that which is extremely profound because it has the nature of nonconceptual intuition.

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyi zhes bya ba ni ye shes rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas so //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyi zhes bya ba ni ye shes rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas so //
translated: By the spontaneous intuition, means by the intuition which functions by its own nature.

original: sngon gyi ched du byas pa'i las kyis zhes bya ba ni dang po nas bdun pa'i bar gyis bsdus pa'i ched du bya ba'i las kyis so //
analyzed: sngon gyi ched du byas pa'i las kyis zhes bya ba ni dang po nas bdun pa'i bar gyis bsdus pa'i ched du bya ba'i las kyis so //
translated: By the action of former effort, means by the action of former effort which is included in the first stage up to the seventh.

original: sa 'dir kho na smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sa 'dir kho na smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: This stage is called the radiant,üîΩbecause the bodhisattva is radiant with the brilliance of the vows.

original: gang don dam pa'i sems bskyed pa dang po'i gnas skabs su smon lam chen po bcu la sogs pa smon lam 'bum phrag grangs med pa phrag bcu gang dag mngon par btab pa de rnams la smon lam zhes bya la /
analyzed: gang don dam pa'i sems bskyed pa dang po'i gnas skabs su smon lam chen po bcu la sogs pa smon lam 'bum phrag grangs med pa phrag bcu gang dag mngon par btab pa de rnams la smon lam zhes bya la /
translated: The prayers that are made at the time of the first generation of the ultimate thought of awakening, such as the ten great prayers, and so forth, are called prayers.

original: smon lam de rnams 'dir rnam par dag par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: smon lam de rnams 'dir rnam par dag par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Those prayers are purified here,

original: yongs su smin pa'i tshul gyis rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas so //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i tshul gyis rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas so //
translated: because they are engaged in naturally by the way of being completely ripened.

original: rgyal ba rnams kyis 'gog las slong bar mdzad //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyis 'gog las slong bar mdzad //
translated: The victors rouse them from cessation.

original: ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de rgyal ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de rgyal ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'gog pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas are roused from cessation by the victors, the Bhagavan Buddhas.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin las slong bar mdzad pas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin las slong bar mdzad pas so //

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,

original: 'dis sems dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dis sems dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the first thought of awakening, and so forth, is stated.

original: 'di la yongs su dag par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'di la yongs su dag par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Here, it is said that they are completely purified because they function spontaneously.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ches lhag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ches lhag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: For this very reason, it is said that the perfection of vows excels for them.üîΩThe bodhisattvas are so called because they are the offspring of the victors, because they are intent on enlightenment, and because they are intent on benefit for beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rgyal ba'i sras gzhon nu'i gnas skabs dang / rgyal tshab kyi gnas skabs dang / rgyal por dbang bskur ba'i gnas skabs gsum du rnam par 'jog @314a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rgyal ba'i sras gzhon nu'i gnas skabs dang / rgyal tshab kyi gnas skabs dang / rgyal por dbang bskur ba'i gnas skabs gsum du rnam par 'jog @314a * //
translated: Just as the bodhisattvas are classified in three stages the stage of the princely youth, the stage of the prince regent, and the stage of the consecrated monarch,

original: pa de bzhin du 'dir brgyad pa la sogs pa gsum la gzhon nu'i gnas skabs dang / rgyal tshab kyi gnas skabs dang / dbang bskur ba'i gnas skabs gsum du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: pa de bzhin du 'dir brgyad pa la sogs pa gsum la gzhon nu'i gnas skabs dang / rgyal tshab kyi gnas skabs dang / dbang bskur ba'i gnas skabs gsum du brjod par bya ste /
translated: so here the three stages the eighth and so on are to be described as the stage of the princely youth, the stage of the prince regent, and the stage of the consecrated monarch.

original: phyir mi ldog pa brnyes pas so //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa brnyes pas so //
translated: Because they have attained the stage of nonregression.

original: 'gog pa las slong bar mdzad pa la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gog pa las slong bar mdzad pa la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural source for arousing from cessation, the following is stated.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung pa te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung pa te /
translated: As it is said, etc.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The power of the generation of former vows refers to

analyzed: 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog / ces bya ba'i smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: the power of the vow, ‚ÄúMay I attain Buddhahood for the benefit of the world.‚Äù

original: chos kyi sgo'i rgyun zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi gdams ngag thos pa de la chos kyi sgo'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sgo'i rgyun zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi gdams ngag thos pa de la chos kyi sgo'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
translated: The stream of the door of Dharma refers to the concentration of the door of Dharma, which is the hearing of the instruction of the Buddhas in concentration.

original: de la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'o //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes nye bar sgrub par mdzad de zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byin gyis rlob par mdzad pa yin no zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes nye bar sgrub par mdzad de zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byin gyis rlob par mdzad pa yin no zhes pa'o ;
translated: The Tathagatas cause the attainment of intuition to be near means that the Tathagatas cause the consecration to occur.

original: / de la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' la'o //
analyzed: / de la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' la'o //
translated: In that, i.e., in the bodhisattva.

analyzed: 'di ni don dam pa'i bzod pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de nyid don dam pa'i bzod pa yang yin no //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos sgrub pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the qualities of a Buddha means the accomplishment of the qualities of a Buddha.

original: sbyor ba byos shig ces bya ba ni de la rtsol ba gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba byos shig ces bya ba ni de la rtsol ba gyis shig ces pa'o //

original: bzod pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ni ma skye ba'i chos la bzod pa de nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i thabs yin pas na sgo'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ni ma skye ba'i chos la bzod pa de nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i thabs yin pas na sgo'o //

analyzed: zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa la gnas kyang zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i ting nge 'dzin gyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can de thob byung ngo //
translated: Even though you abide in the liberation of peace means that you have attained the meditative absorption of the reality limit.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yid dbyen spyo ba yin zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs pas sems nye bar bcom pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yid dbyen spyo ba yin zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs pas sems nye bar bcom pa'o //

analyzed: 'di dag la soms shig ces bya ba ni sems la gyis shig ces pa'o //

original: sngon gyi smon lam dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam dang zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par @314b shog ; ces bya ba'i smon lam btab pa de dran par gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: Remember your prayer: May I attain buddhahood for the benefit of the world!

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon du byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon du byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The gateway to the realization of omniscient wisdom means the cause for realizing omniscient wisdom.

original: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: You refers to the bodhisattva.

original: de nyid kyi tshe yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa las mi ldang bas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa las mi ldang bas so //
translated: At that time, he will attain complete nirvana, because he will not rise from cessation.

original: de ni sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu ba ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu ba ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that for bodhisattvas who are on the eighth stage, the manifestation of the mental afflictions does not exist,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúbecause‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad par yang dang yang du 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad par yang dang yang du 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause‚Ä¶‚Äù refers to the fact that on the eighth stage, he repeatedly attains the concentration of cessation.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthis one‚Äù refers to the bodhisattva.

original: chags pa med pa'i blo ni /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i blo ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhis mind is free from attachment‚Äù means

original: skyon rnams dag dang lhan cig mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: skyon rnams dag dang lhan cig mi gnas phyir //
translated: that he does not remain together with the faults.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang chags pa med pa'i blo ste /üîΩmngon par zhen pa med pa'i blo de ni skyon rnams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang chags pa med pa'i blo ste / mngon par zhen pa med pa'i blo de ni skyon rnams te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhis mind is free from attachment‚Äù meansüîΩthat his mind is free from clinging.üîΩThat mind which is free from clinging does not remain together with the faults,

analyzed: nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu ba rnams dang lhan cig tu gnas pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: which are the mental afflictions that manifest.

analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu ba rnams ni yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: There, the manifest afflictions do not exist.

original: de dag rtsar bcas zhes bya ba ni mngon du rgyu ba rnams kyi nyon mongs pa phra ba yang log pas so //
analyzed: de dag rtsar bcas zhes bya ba ni mngon du rgyu ba rnams kyi nyon mongs pa phra ba yang log pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúAlong with their roots‚Äù means that the subtle afflictions of the manifest ones are also reversed.

original: dri ma zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dri ma zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //

analyzed: nye bar zhi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúAre pacified‚Äù means that the afflictions are abandoned.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan khyad par can de rnams kyis thob pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan khyad par can de rnams kyis thob pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Even though the afflictions are abandoned, it is not the case that one attains those special qualities of the Blessed Buddhas. In order to teach this, it is said:

original: nyon mongs zad cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩsangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs zad cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'byor pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEven though the afflictions are exhausted‚Ä¶‚ÄùüîΩThe Blessed Buddhas have mastery over all qualities.

original: yon tan thams cad yang dag par 'byor pa yin pa de rnams thob par mi nus pas so //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad yang dag par 'byor pa yin pa de rnams thob par mi nus pas so //
translated: It is not possible to attain those.

original: 'byor pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: 'byor pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: The special mastery is taught:

original: mkha' ltar mtha' bral zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mkha' ltar mtha' bral zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúLike space, they are free from extremes.‚Äù

original: nam mkha' ltar yon tan yang dag par 'byor pa mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar yon tan yang dag par 'byor pa mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: and the infinite perfection of the qualities of the sky.

original: nyon mongs zad cing zhes bya ba ni mngon du rgyu ba'i khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs zad cing zhes bya ba ni mngon du rgyu ba'i khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas so //
translated: The phrase the afflictions are exhausted means that the afflictions of the three realms that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing have been eliminated.

original: de'i phyir / sa gsum bla mar gyur kyang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / sa gsum bla mar gyur kyang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, Even though they are superior to the three realms.

original: khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas khams gsum gyi bla ma zhes bya ste /üîΩ'di'i don ni khams gsum gyi nyon @315a * //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas khams gsum gyi bla ma zhes bya ste / 'di'i don ni khams gsum gyi nyon @315a * //
translated: They are called superior to the three realms because they have eliminated the afflictions of the three realms.

original: mongs pa rnams spangs su zin kyang de rnams kyi bag chags yod pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mtha' yas pa'i yon tan rnams kyi mthar thug par ni ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mongs pa rnams spangs su zin kyang de rnams kyi bag chags yod pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mtha' yas pa'i yon tan rnams kyi mthar thug par ni ma gyur pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this passage is as follows: Even though the afflictions of the three realms have been eliminated, the Blessed Ones have not yet reached the end of their infinite qualities because the propensities for those afflictions still remain.

original: de'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i bag chags yod pa'i phyir da dung yang phyir mi 'ong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes mngon pa las rnam gzhag byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i bag chags yod pa'i phyir da dung yang phyir mi 'ong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes mngon pa las rnam gzhag byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Abhidharmako≈õa states, Because the propensities for the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation still remain, they are not yet non-returners.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that commentary,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe non-conceptual sun has risen,üîΩand the causes of birth in cyclic existence have ceased.‚Äù

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de nyid nyi ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de nyid nyi ma yin la /
translated: That non-conceptual wisdom itself is the sun.

original: de shar ba ste skyes pas so //
analyzed: de shar ba ste skyes pas so //
translated: When it has risen, that is, when it has arisen,üîΩthe causes of birth in cyclic existence have ceased.

original: 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu rnams log pas yin gyi /

analyzed: des na mtha' dang dbus med pa zhes bya ba'i sgras don dam par thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus med pa'i chos te /

original: de'i don ni chos la dbang ba nyid kyis mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi sgo rnams kyis dus gcig tu sems can thams cad kyi sems yongs su dga' bar byed par 'gyur ba'o //

translated: This is the commentary on the eighth verse of the chapter on the cultivation of the aids to merit and knowledge.üîΩIn order to teach the ninth generation of the mind of enlightenment,üîΩhe says,üîΩNow, the bodhisattvas, having completed the seventh ground,

analyzed: // / sems bskyed pa dgu pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir / da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: having attained the eighth ground, Immovability,üîΩthey attain the power of the perfection of wisdom,üîΩand they attain the power of the perfection of skillful means.üîΩThey attain the power of the perfection of aspiration,üîΩand they attain the power of the perfection of strength.üîΩThey attain the power of the perfection of concentration,üîΩand they attain the power of the perfection of knowledge.üîΩThey attain the power of the perfection of the perfections,üîΩand they attain the power of the perfection of the aids to enlightenment.üîΩThey attain the power of the perfection of the factors of enlightenment,üîΩand they attain the power of the perfection of the faculties.üîΩThey attain the power of the perfection of the powers,üîΩand they attain the power of the perfection of the branches of enlightenment.üîΩThey attain the power of the perfection of the path,üîΩand they attain the power of the perfection of the concentrations.üîΩThey attain the power of the perfection of the immeasurables,üîΩand they attain the power of the perfection of the formless absorptions.üîΩThey attain the power of the perfection of the liberations,üîΩand they attain the power of the perfection of the totalities.üîΩThey attain the power of the perfection of the bases of mastery,üîΩand they attain the power of the perfection of the bases of subjugation.üîΩThey attain the power of the perfection of the unentangled qualities,

original: stobs mtha' dag rdzogs pa dag 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags pa'i stobs dang bsgoms pa'i stobs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi stobs thams cad rab kyi mthar son par 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: yang dag rig chos rang gi yon tan yongs su dag pa'ang thob //
translated: They attain the power of the perfection of the knowledge of the path,üîΩand they attain the power of the perfection of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThey attain the power of the perfection of the knowledge of the aspects of the path,üîΩand they attain the power of the perfection of the knowledge of the aspects of all aspects.

original: ces bya ba ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa bzhi rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa yongs su shes pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rang gi yon tan dag pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: yongs su dag par 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni rab kyi gnas skabs thob pa'o //

analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: chos rnams spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas so sor rig pa ni @317b don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //

translated: The general characteristic is impermanence, etc.üîΩHe knows how to teach the dharmas without confusing them. This is the knowledge of how to teach the dharmas without confusing them by means of the knowledge of the language of the country and of the etymological explanation.

original: mthun pa'i rgyun rgyun chad pa med pa nyid du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni chos rnams rab tu 'du shes pa dang btags par yod pa la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba ston pa'i sgo nas chos ston pa'i rgyun chad pa med pa nyid du
analyzed: mthun pa'i rgyun rgyun chad pa med pa nyid du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni chos rnams rab tu 'du shes pa dang btags par yod pa la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba ston pa'i sgo nas chos ston pa'i rgyun chad pa med pa nyid du
translated: He knows how to teach the Dharma without interrupting the continuity of the agreeable. This is the knowledge of how to teach the Dharma without interrupting the continuity of the teaching by means of the knowledge of the teaching of the Dharma, the knowledge of the classification of the teaching of the Dharma, and the knowledge of the various kinds of teaching of the Dharma.

original: med pa rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: med pa rab tu shes pa'o //

analyzed: 'dir ni gzhung 'dir rjes su 'brangs nas bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: de dag la cung zad kyang khyad par yod kyang skyon yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Although there is a slight difference between them, there is no fault,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya dang rjes su bstan nas chos ston pa'i khyad par cung zad yod pas so //

analyzed: 'di ni sa legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya ste /

translated: In order to teach the characteristics of the bodhisattva on the tenth stage of generating the mind, he says, now, etc.

analyzed: kun nas sangs rgyas rnams las zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams las so //

analyzed: dbang bskur ba dam pa thob cing zhes bya ba ni 'od zer gyi sgo nas bskur bas so //

analyzed: de yis zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o // ye shes lhag par mchog tu gyur pa'ang yin //
translated: He means the bodhisattva.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos ston pa la sgras ji bzhin pa la rmongs pa dang bral bas dgongs pa can gyi don yongs su shes pa rab kyi mthar phyin pas so //
translated: And also has the highest special knowledge means that he has reached the culmination of the highest knowledge of the thoroughly knowable, because he is free from confusion about the literal meaning of the teaching of the Dharma.

analyzed: sa bcu pa 'di yang chos kyi sprin zhes kyang brjod par bya'o // de la sgras 'jug pa'i @318a * //

analyzed: rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reason for engaging with the word, he says,

original: char sprin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: char sprin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The tenth is called Cloud of Dharma.

original: ji ltar char sprin rnams la lo tog skye ba'i phyir char 'bebs pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i lo tog gi ched du rtsol ba med par chos kyi char 'bebs par mdzad pas na chos kyi sprin zhes bya ste /

translated: Just as rain clouds rain down in order to make crops grow, in the same way, bodhisattvas rain down the rain of Dharma effortlessly in order to make the crops of virtue grow, such as the generation of bodhicitta and so on. Therefore, it is called Cloud of Dharma.

original: sprin bzhin du chos kyi char 'bebs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sprin bzhin du chos kyi char 'bebs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is like a cloud in raining down the rain of Dharma.

original: 'di rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas sprin dang chos mtshungs /
analyzed: 'di rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas sprin dang chos mtshungs /

original: khyab pa dang / rdul rab tu zhi bar byed pa dang / 'byin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa dang / rdul rab tu zhi bar byed pa dang / 'byin par byed pa'o //
translated: It is pervasive, it pacifies dust, and it produces.

original: de la khyab pa ni sa 'dir chos thos pas nam mkha' bzhin du rten thams cad khyab par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de la khyab pa ni sa 'dir chos thos pas nam mkha' bzhin du rten thams cad khyab par 'gyur bas so //
translated: It is pervasive because on this level, by hearing the Dharma, one pervades all the worlds like the sky.

original: rdul rab tu zhi bar byed pa ni chos des sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rdul rab tu zhi bar byed pas so //
analyzed: rdul rab tu zhi bar byed pa ni chos des sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rdul rab tu zhi bar byed pas so //
translated: It pacifies dust because that Dharma pacifies the dust of the afflictions of sentient beings.

original: 'byin par byed pa ni sprin gyi char gyis lo tog 'byin par byed pa bzhin du dga' ldan gyi gnas su gnas pa la sogs pa'i rim pas sems can rnams 'dren par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'byin par byed pa ni sprin gyi char gyis lo tog 'byin par byed pa bzhin du dga' ldan gyi gnas su gnas pa la sogs pa'i rim pas sems can rnams 'dren par byed pas so //
translated: The ejaculation is like the rain from the clouds, which causes the crops to grow, and it is the Bodhisattva who, by the process of dwelling in the Tusita heaven, etc., leads sentient beings.

analyzed: 'dir char 'bab pa dang mtshungs par brjod pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'o //

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, the Bodhisattva, etc.

original: dbang bskur ba la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural source for the consecration,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, as it is said, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin grangs med pa 'bum phrag bcu ji snyed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin grangs med pa 'bum phrag bcu ji snyed pa zhes bya ba la /

original: de 'bum phrag drug cu 'gyur du bsgres pa ni ting nge 'dzin grangs med pa 'bum phrag bcu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de 'bum phrag drug cu 'gyur du bsgres pa ni ting nge 'dzin grangs med pa 'bum phrag bcu zhes bya'o //
translated: and the multiplication of that by six hundred thousand is called innumerable hundreds of thousands of samadhis.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dbang bskur ba dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa'i don du 'od zer gyi sgo nas dbang thob pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dbang bskur ba dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa'i don du 'od zer gyi sgo nas dbang thob pa'o //
translated: Endowed with the consecration of the knowledge of omniscience means that by means of the light rays, one obtains the consecration for the sake of attaining the knowledge of omniscience, abiding in whatever meditative stabilization.

original: stong gsum phrag bcu'i gtos dang mnyam pa'i zhes bya ba ni ri rab dang gling bzhi la sogs pa stong la stong spyi phud ces bya la /
analyzed: stong gsum phrag bcu'i gtos dang mnyam pa'i zhes bya ba ni ri rab dang gling bzhi la sogs pa stong la stong spyi phud ces bya la /
translated: Equal to the size of ten trichiliocosms means that a thousand Mount Merus, four continents, and so forth is called a small chiliocosm.

original: de stong 'gyur la stong gnyis bya la /üîΩstong gnyis stong 'gyur du bsgres pa ni stong gsum zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de stong 'gyur la stong gnyis bya la / stong gnyis stong 'gyur du bsgres pa ni stong gsum zhes bya ba la /
translated: A thousand of those is called a dichiliocosm.üîΩA dichiliocosm multiplied by a thousand is called a trichiliocosm.

original: stong gsum bcu 'gyur du bsgres pa ni tshad dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: stong gsum bcu 'gyur du bsgres pa ni tshad dang mnyam pa'o //

analyzed: ci ltar gal te sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skye bar gyur na de'i tshe sngon po la sogs pa'i yul shes pa des yongs su shes so zhes tha snyad byed pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: If a consciousness that has the aspect of blue arises, at that time, since the object, such as blue, is cognized by that consciousness, it is conventionally said that it is cognized, but not ultimately.

original: don dam par phyi rol gyi don mi snang bas so //
analyzed: don dam par phyi rol gyi don mi snang bas so //
translated: Because ultimately external objects do not appear.

original: de bzhin tha snyad brten nas rig pa yin //
analyzed: de bzhin tha snyad brten nas rig pa yin //
translated: In the same way, consciousness is posited in dependence on convention.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngon po yongs su shes pa bzhin du tha snyad la brten nas de kho na nyid thugs su chud par brjod pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngon po yongs su shes pa bzhin du tha snyad la brten nas de kho na nyid thugs su chud par brjod pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: This is saying that, just as one understands blue, one understands reality in dependence on conventions, but not ultimately.

original: 'di'i don ni ji ltar dus mnyam pa la phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa mi mthun pas sngon po la sogs pa'i don nyams su myong ba med kyang sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyes pas sngon po nyams su myong ba yin no zhes nye bar btags nas rnam gzhag byed pa de bzhin du 'dir
analyzed: 'di'i don ni ji ltar dus mnyam pa la phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa mi mthun pas sngon po la sogs pa'i don nyams su myong ba med kyang sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyes pas sngon po nyams su myong ba yin no zhes nye bar btags nas rnam gzhag byed pa de bzhin du 'dir
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Just as, since the object to be benefited and the benefactor are not simultaneous, although the object such as blue is not experienced, since a consciousness having the aspect of blue arises, one imputes the experience of blue and posits it.

original: yang blo la skye ba med pa'i rnam pa yod pas skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis de kho na nyid du @325b nyams su myong bar btags nas rnam par 'jog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang blo la skye ba med pa'i rnam pa yod pas skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis de kho na nyid du @325b nyams su myong bar btags nas rnam par 'jog pa yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, here also, since the mind has an aspect of nonarising, one imputes the experience of reality, which has the characteristic of nonarising, and posits it.

original: dngos su ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos su ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not actual,

original: de kho na nyid spros pa mtha' dag las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid spros pa mtha' dag las 'das pa'i phyir ro //

original: des na dngos po gang yang rung mi dmigs pa de nyid de kho na nyid thugs su chud pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dngos po gang yang rung mi dmigs pa de nyid de kho na nyid thugs su chud pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the non-observation of any entity whatsoever is the realization of reality.

original: de la khyed kyis nyams su ma myong ba gang yin pa de nyams su myong bar ji ltar rigs te /
analyzed: de la khyed kyis nyams su ma myong ba gang yin pa de nyams su myong bar ji ltar rigs te /

original: de gnyis phan tshun 'gal ba yin te zhes gang smras pa de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de gnyis phan tshun 'gal ba yin te zhes gang smras pa de yang mi rigs te /
translated: And what was said, ‚ÄúThose two are mutually contradictory,‚Äù is also not reasonable.

original: gang de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa de nyid la de kho na nyid rtogs par mi brjod la /
analyzed: gang de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa de nyid la de kho na nyid rtogs par mi brjod la /
translated: That which does not realize reality is not said to realize reality.

original: 'on kyang dngos po gang yang mi dmigs pa de de kho na nyid nyams su myong ba yin pas 'gal bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po gang yang mi dmigs pa de de kho na nyid nyams su myong ba yin pas 'gal bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: However, since the non-observation of any entity whatsoever is the experience of reality, how could there be a contradiction?

original: de 'grel bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says ‚Äúthis‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di na zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i gnas skabs na'o de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed na'o //
analyzed: 'di na zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i gnas skabs na'o de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù means in the context of reasoning. ‚ÄúConforming to its aspect‚Äù means conforming to the aspect of the object.

original: shes pa de kho na nyid kyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa skye ba na zhes bya ba ni shes pa yang skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas so //üîΩde'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid ces bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa de kho na nyid kyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa skye ba na zhes bya ba ni shes pa yang skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas so // de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid ces bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'o //
translated: When consciousness arises in the aspect of reality, that is, when consciousness arises in the aspect of non-arising,üîΩit is said to be ‚Äúin the aspect of that reality.‚Äù

original: de rnams brten las zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi rnam pa brten pa la'o //
analyzed: de rnams brten las zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi rnam pa brten pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that support‚Äù means from the support of that reality.

original: gal te dngos su rtogs pa ma yin par brtags nas yin par ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos su rtogs pa ma yin par brtags nas yin par ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is not directly realized, why is it imagined to be so?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the answer to that,

original: shes pa dang shes bya gnyis ga yang ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya gnyis ga yang ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said that ‚Äúboth consciousness and the object of consciousness are non-arisen.‚Äù

original: mkhyen pa med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mkhyen pa med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: As for what was said about the absence of knowledge, etc., in order to show the answer to that,üîΩit is said ‚ÄúIf it is imagined that there is no knowledge, etc.,‚Äù

original: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: shes pa 'di skye ba med pa kho na yin par bden mod kyi zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad la skye ba ma grub pas ye shes kyang skye ba med pa nyid do //

original: 'dir 'ga' zhig ni bcom ldan 'das la sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes yod par 'dod la /
analyzed: 'dir 'ga' zhig ni bcom ldan 'das la sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes yod par 'dod la /

analyzed: de yang don dam par skye ba med pa'i phyir shes pa yang skye ba med pa yin no zhes brjod la /
translated: Moreover, since that is ultimately unproduced, consciousness is also unproduced.

original: ye shes de yang ldog pa'i sgo nas lta ste /
analyzed: ye shes de yang ldog pa'i sgo nas lta ste /

analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes dang / me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is the pristine wisdom of the extremely pure expanse of reality, the mirror-like, the equality, the individually discerning, and the pristine wisdom that accomplishes activities.

original: de la @326a * //
analyzed: de la @326a * //
translated: With regard to that,

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa gnyis dang bral ba'i snying rje dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'o spangs pa dang rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa mnga' ba de kho na nyid bsgom pa rab kyi

translated: The pristine wisdom of the extremely pure sphere of reality is the non-duality of compassion and wisdom free from the two obscurations together with their habitual tendencies.

analyzed: mthar gyur pa chos kyi dbyings su thugs su chud pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of abandonment and realization is the culmination of the best meditation on reality, which is the realization of the sphere of reality.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni gang du mtha' med pa'i khams gsum gyi sems can dang cig shos ring ba dang / cig shos kyi yul las 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba'i dngos po rdul phra rab dang / gnas skabs so sor me long la gzugs brnyan bzhin du thams cad la gsal bar snang ba'o //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni gang du mtha' med pa'i khams gsum gyi sems can dang cig shos ring ba dang / cig shos kyi yul las 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba'i dngos po rdul phra rab dang / gnas skabs so sor me long la gzugs brnyan bzhin du thams cad la gsal bar snang ba'o //
translated: Mirror-like pristine wisdom is the appearance in it of everything, like reflections in a mirror, of the limitless sentient beings of the three realms, of the past and future and present things, of the subtle particles and of the individual states, without any sense of near or far, beyond the domain of the other pristine wisdoms.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni gang gis de ltar gzugs brnyan lta bur snang ba'i 'gro ba rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid du thugs su chud nas sems can thams cad la rtag tu bdag nyid dang mnyam pa'i thugs brnyes pa'o //üîΩso sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni gang gis bcom ldan 'das de ltar mnyam par bzhag pas rnam par mi rtog pa kho na yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni gang gis de ltar gzugs brnyan lta bur snang ba'i 'gro ba rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid du thugs su chud nas sems can thams cad la rtag tu bdag nyid dang mnyam pa'i thugs brnyes pa'o // so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni gang gis bcom ldan 'das de ltar mnyam par bzhag pas rnam par mi rtog pa kho na yin du zin kyang /
translated: The wisdom of equality is that by which the Lord, having realized the equality of the selflessness of phenomena in the world which appears like a reflection, always attains the same attitude of equality toward all sentient beings.

original: sngon gyi smon lam dang / sems can rnams kyi bsod nams kyi dbang gis sems can rnams kyi spyod pa so sor rtog pa'o//
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam dang / sems can rnams kyi bsod nams kyi dbang gis sems can rnams kyi spyod pa so sor rtog pa'o//
translated: The wisdom of individual investigation is that by which the Lord, even though he is equipoised in that way and is non-conceptual, individually investigates the conduct of sentient beings by the power of his former prayers and the merit of sentient beings.

original: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes ni gang gis de ltar rtogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams la bya ba sgrub par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes ni gang gis de ltar rtogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams la bya ba sgrub par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The wisdom which accomplishes activities is that by which the Lord accomplishes the activities of those sentient beings who are to be trained in that way.

original: ye shes lnga po 'di rnams ni sku gsum gyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes lnga po 'di rnams ni sku gsum gyis bsdus pa ste /

original: yid kyi rnam shes gang yin de //

analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes yin //

original: de dag longs spyod rdzogs sku nyid //üîΩchos kyi longs spyod gzigs phyir dang // byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams //
analyzed: de dag longs spyod rdzogs sku nyid // chos kyi longs spyod gzigs phyir dang // byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams //
translated: These are the enjoyment body itself,üîΩBecause it sees the enjoyment of DharmaüîΩAnd because it is the cause

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyang //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyang //

analyzed: kha cig longs spyod rdzogs skur brjod //

original: kha cig de yang de rgyu yis //
analyzed: kha cig de yang de rgyu yis //

analyzed: sgo lnga'i dbang po'i shes pa gang //
translated: The consciousnesses of the five sense doors,üîΩWhen transformed, are the wisdomüîΩThat accomplishes all activities,

analyzed: de yang thams cad thams cad du // dus dang @326b bsam pa ji lta bar // sangs rgyas ye shes sprul sku ste //
