analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das rnams la dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba rigs pa yin te /
translated: For that very reason, it is reasonable that the Buddhas do not have any loss of mindfulness,

original: dus thams cad du dngos po thams cad me long bzhin du snang bas so //
analyzed: dus thams cad du dngos po thams cad me long bzhin du snang bas so //
translated: because all things appear to them like reflections at all times.

original: ye shes gzhan rnams ni dus res 'ga' ba yin pas g-yo bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes gzhan rnams ni dus res 'ga' ba yin pas g-yo bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other wisdoms are not always present, and so they can be moved.

original: gdul bya rnams kyis de ltar brtag pas so //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyis de ltar brtag pas so //
translated: It is so because those to be trained think that way.

original: des na me long lta bu'i ye shes la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur gang brjod pa de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na me long lta bu'i ye shes la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur gang brjod pa de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, what is called the mirror-like intuition is the causal basis of the beatific body.

original: sgo lnga'i dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: sgo lnga'i dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The five sense-consciousnesses, etc.

original: gang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa de sems can thams cad kyi don du gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pas bya ba grub pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i ming brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa de sems can thams cad kyi don du gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pas bya ba grub pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i ming brnyes pa yin no //
translated: That which is the transformation of the five sense-consciousnesses, because it takes on the form of form, sound, etc. for the sake of all beings, is called the ‚Äúintuition of successful activities.‚Äù

original: de nyid sprul pa'i sku yin no zhes bstan pa yin /
analyzed: de nyid sprul pa'i sku yin no zhes bstan pa yin /
translated: That is the emanation body.

original: de yang thams cad thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin /
analyzed: de yang thams cad thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin /
translated: That is also taught in the passage beginning with ‚Äúall in all ways,‚Äù etc.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the intuition of successful activities.

original: thams cad thams cad du zhes bya ba ni dus dang yul dag tu'o ;
analyzed: thams cad thams cad du zhes bya ba ni dus dang yul dag tu'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúAll in all ways‚Äù refers to time and place.

original: / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi bsam pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi bsam pa bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAccording to their aspirations‚Äù means according to the aspirations of beings.

original: kha cig yid ni kho na las //
analyzed: kha cig yid ni kho na las //
translated: Some say that it is only the mental consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba ni kha cig yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur ba la sprul pa'i sku zhes brjod de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kha cig yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur ba la sprul pa'i sku zhes brjod de /
translated: Some say that the transformation of the mental consciousness is called the emanation body.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa las sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o ;
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa las sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o ;
translated: It is the mental consciousness that has been transformed that performs the benefit of sentient beings.

original: / sgo lnga'i rnam shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /üîΩgang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa de longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur brjod pa ste /
analyzed: / sgo lnga'i rnam shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni / gang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa de longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur brjod pa ste /
translated: The five sense consciousnesses, etc.

original: khyad par can gyi bee d'urya la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sku la sogs par snang ba 'byung bas so //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi bee d'urya la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sku la sogs par snang ba 'byung bas so //
translated: The five sense consciousnesses are called the enjoyment body because the appearance of the body and so on, which is the nature of special vaidurya, and so on, arises.

original: ye shes lnga po 'di rnams kyang ldog pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa yin gyi rgyu ba tha dad pa la yod pa'i shes pa lnga rang bzhin du tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ye shes lnga po 'di rnams kyang ldog pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa yin gyi rgyu ba tha dad pa la yod pa'i shes pa lnga rang bzhin du tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: These five gnoses are different in terms of their isolates, but they are not different in terms of the five consciousnesses that exist as different states.

original: 'di ltar gcig nyid la chos kyi dbyings mkhyen pa'i sgo nas chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes su rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig nyid la chos kyi dbyings mkhyen pa'i sgo nas chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes su rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin la /
translated: Thus, in a single moment, the dharmadhatu is posited as the gnosis of the extremely pure dharmadhatu, by means of knowing the dharmadhatu.

original: de nyid rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos @327b thams cad yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas me long lta bu'i ye shes su rnam par 'jog pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos de rnams mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i sgo nas de nyid la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su rnam par 'jog cing /
analyzed: de nyid rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos @327b thams cad yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas me long lta bu'i ye shes su rnam par 'jog pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos de rnams mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i sgo nas de nyid la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su rnam par 'jog cing /
translated: That very gnosis is posited as mirrorlike gnosis by means of knowing all phenomena that are dependently arisen, and it is posited as the gnosis of equality by means of realizing the equality of all those dependently arisen phenomena.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams la 'dod chags la sogs par yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas de nyid la so sor rtog pa'i ye shes su rnam gzhag byed la /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams la 'dod chags la sogs par yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas de nyid la so sor rtog pa'i ye shes su rnam gzhag byed la /
translated: It is posited as the individually discerning gnosis by means of knowing the dependently arisen phenomena of the mind and mental factors as desire and so on.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i spyod pa'i sems can rnams la bsam pa ji ltar 'os pa bzhin du chos ston pa yongs su mkhyen pa'i sgo nas de nyid la bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes rnam gzhag byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i spyod pa'i sems can rnams la bsam pa ji ltar 'os pa bzhin du chos ston pa yongs su mkhyen pa'i sgo nas de nyid la bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes rnam gzhag byed pa yin no //
translated: The gnosis that accomplishes activities is posited in terms of the gnosis that fully knows how to teach the Dharma to sentient beings who engage in conduct such as attachment and so on in accordance with their thoughts.

original: des na ye shes gcig nyid la cha dang char tha dad par rtogs nas ye shes lngar rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na ye shes gcig nyid la cha dang char tha dad par rtogs nas ye shes lngar rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the five gnoses are posited by realizing that a single gnosis has different aspects and parts.

original: ye shes gcig gis bsdus pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyang tshul 'di bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes gcig gis bsdus pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyang tshul 'di bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The qualities such as the close placement of mindfulness that are included within a single gnosis should be understood in the same way.

original: de rnams ye shes gcig dang ro gcig tu gyur pas so //
analyzed: de rnams ye shes gcig dang ro gcig tu gyur pas so //
translated: They are of one taste with a single gnosis.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa yod pa ni rgyu'i gnas skabs la brten nas yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa yod pa ni rgyu'i gnas skabs la brten nas yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The existence of different characteristics should be understood to be based on the causal state.

original: ye shes de yang chos kyi dbyings su shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes la sogs pa'i ye shes bzhi'i rang bzhin can la ni dngos gzhi'i rnam gzhag byed pa yin no /
analyzed: ye shes de yang chos kyi dbyings su shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes la sogs pa'i ye shes bzhi'i rang bzhin can la ni dngos gzhi'i rnam gzhag byed pa yin no /
translated: The four kinds of gnosis, such as the gnosis that is utterly pure within the dharmadhatu, are posited as the actual basis of the Buddha's gnosis.

original: de'i dbang gis chos ston pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ye shes de nyid bya ba sgrub pa'i cha nas rjes thob kyi ye shes su rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis chos ston pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ye shes de nyid bya ba sgrub pa'i cha nas rjes thob kyi ye shes su rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: And because the teaching of the Dharma is fully accomplished by the power of that gnosis, that gnosis itself is posited as the gnosis of subsequent attainment from the point of view of its function.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi ye shes sgyu ma lta bur 'dod pa rnams kyi rnam gzhag de ltar yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi ye shes sgyu ma lta bur 'dod pa rnams kyi rnam gzhag de ltar yin no //
translated: This is how the system of those who assert that the Buddha's gnosis is like an illusion is presented.

original: gzhan rnams kyi ni rnam gzhag 'di ltar ston te /
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyi ni rnam gzhag 'di ltar ston te /
translated: The system of others is presented as follows.

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das la ye shes yod par 'dod na ye shes de bcom ldan 'das la snang ngam mi snang /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das la ye shes yod par 'dod na ye shes de bcom ldan 'das la snang ngam mi snang /
translated: If you assert that the Buddha has gnosis, does that gnosis appear to the Buddha or not?

original: gal te mi snang bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te mi snang bar 'gyur na /
translated: If it does not appear,

original: de'i tshe de yod pa ma yin no zhes ji ltar tha snyad byed /
analyzed: de'i tshe de yod pa ma yin no zhes ji ltar tha snyad byed /
translated: then how can you say that it exists?

original: gal te snang bar 'gyur na don dam par snang ba de yod pa cig snang ba yin nam 'on te med pa cig snang ba yin /
analyzed: gal te snang bar 'gyur na don dam par snang ba de yod pa cig snang ba yin nam 'on te med pa cig snang ba yin /
translated: If it were to appear, would the appearance be the appearance of something that exists ultimately or would it be the appearance of something that does not exist ultimately?

original: de la phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: The first possibility is not tenable,üîΩbecause the Transcendent Lord has refuted the existence of wisdom ultimately, as stated in the lines: ‚ÄúNot from itself, nor from another, nor from both, nor without cause,

original: bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes don dam par bkag pas so //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes don dam par bkag pas so //
translated: ‚Äù and so on.

original: don dam par med kyang snang na ni bcom ldan 'das rnams la ma rig pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde @328a * //
analyzed: don dam par med kyang snang na ni bcom ldan 'das rnams la ma rig pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ro // de @328a * //
translated: If something were to appear even though it does not exist ultimately, then it would follow that the Transcendent Lord would have ignorance.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba gsungs pas so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba gsungs pas so //
translated: Because it is stated: ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic processes. Conditioned by karmic processes, there is consciousness.‚Äù

original: gal te ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dis nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i 'khor bar gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa la ma rig pa'i rkyen can du gsungs pa yin gyi shes pa thams cad la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dis nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i 'khor bar gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa la ma rig pa'i rkyen can du gsungs pa yin gyi shes pa thams cad la ni ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the statement ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic processes‚Äù and so on refers to the consciousness that is part of cyclic existence that is associated with afflictions and that it is not saying that all consciousnesses are conditioned by ignorance,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes ni snying rje'i rgyu can yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes ni snying rje'i rgyu can yin te /
translated: The wisdom of the Bhagavans is caused by compassion,

original: snying rje'i stobs kyis bcom ldan 'das rnams 'khor ba ji srid du bzhugs pas so //
analyzed: snying rje'i stobs kyis bcom ldan 'das rnams 'khor ba ji srid du bzhugs pas so //
translated: because the Bhagavans remain in cyclic existence for as long as it lasts through the power of compassion.üîΩFor example, even though a lamp is caused by oil, when the oil is exhausted, if more oil is added, it does not stop.

original: dper na mar me dang po 'bru mar gyis rgyu can yin du zin kyang 'bru mar zad nas mar blugs na mi ldog pa de bzhin du 'dir yang shes pa ma rig pa'i rgyu can yin du zin kyang ma rig pa log nas snying rje'i stobs kyis ye
analyzed: dper na mar me dang po 'bru mar gyis rgyu can yin du zin kyang 'bru mar zad nas mar blugs na mi ldog pa de bzhin du 'dir yang shes pa ma rig pa'i rgyu can yin du zin kyang ma rig pa log nas snying rje'i stobs kyis ye
translated: Similarly, even though consciousness is caused by ignorance, when ignorance is stopped, wisdom is caused by the power of compassion,

original: shes snang bas bcom ldan 'das rnams ma rig pa dang bcas par thal bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: shes snang bas bcom ldan 'das rnams ma rig pa dang bcas par thal bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and the Bhagavans are not said to have ignorance.üîΩIn this regard, some say: Let the Bhagavans be caused by the power of compassion.

original: de la kha cig na re bcom ldan 'das rnams la snying rje'i stobs kyis ye shes snang du chug / de ltar na yang ma rig pa log par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re bcom ldan 'das rnams la snying rje'i stobs kyis ye shes snang du chug / de ltar na yang ma rig pa log par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even so, ignorance is not stopped.

original: 'di ltar gal te snying rje'i dbang gis ye shes snang bar gyur na de'i don dam par yod pa'i ye shes snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te snying rje'i dbang gis ye shes snang bar gyur na de'i don dam par yod pa'i ye shes snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Thus, if the appearance of gnosis were to occur through the power of compassion, then the appearance of gnosis would not exist ultimately.

original: don dam par yod pa sngar bkag zin pas so //
analyzed: don dam par yod pa sngar bkag zin pas so //
translated: This is because ultimate existence has already been refuted.

original: don dam par med par snang ba gang yin pa de 'khrul pa med par mi rigs te /
analyzed: don dam par med par snang ba gang yin pa de 'khrul pa med par mi rigs te /
translated: That which appears without ultimate existence is not suitable to be nonerroneous.

original: dper na rab rib can la med pa'i skra shad dang zla ba la sogs pa snang ba 'khrul pa med na mi rigs la /
analyzed: dper na rab rib can la med pa'i skra shad dang zla ba la sogs pa snang ba 'khrul pa med na mi rigs la /
translated: For example, the appearance of nonexistent floating hairs and moons to those with eye disease is not suitable to be nonerroneous.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang med par snang bar 'khrul pa med na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang med par snang bar 'khrul pa med na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: In the same way, here, if the appearance of nonexistent things were not erroneous, it would not occur.

original: 'khrul pa yang ma rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yang ma rig pa nyid do //
translated: And error is ignorance.

original: des na sangs rgyas la snying rje sngon du 'gro ba can gyi ye shes mnga' na ma rig pa dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas la snying rje sngon du 'gro ba can gyi ye shes mnga' na ma rig pa dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, if the Buddha possesses gnosis preceded by compassion, it follows he would possess ignorance.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa la ma rig pa yod kyang skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa la ma rig pa yod kyang skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: If the TathƒÅgata possesses ignorance, what is the problem?

original: ma yin te phyi rol pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams bzhin du bcom ldan 'das rnams la yang ma rig pa sngon du 'gro ba'i nyon mongs pa 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma yin te phyi rol pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams bzhin du bcom ldan 'das rnams la yang ma rig pa sngon du 'gro ba'i nyon mongs pa 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: No, because it would follow that the afflictions would engage in the Bhagavans, just as they do in those who are free from attachment to external objects.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: gang gi phyir phyi rol pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bas ni ma rig pa ma rig pa nyid du ma shes pa yin la bcom ldan @328b 'das rnams kyis ma rig pa nyid du mkhyen pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyi rol pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bas ni ma rig pa ma rig pa nyid du ma shes pa yin la bcom ldan @328b 'das rnams kyis ma rig pa nyid du mkhyen pa yin la /
translated: because those who are free from attachment to external objects do not know ignorance to be ignorance, but the Bhagavans know ignorance to be ignorance.

original: de nas de sngon du 'gro ba'i nyon mongs pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nas de sngon du 'gro ba'i nyon mongs pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: And from that, the afflictions that precede it do not engage.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ma rig pa nyid du mkhyen du zin kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la ma rig pa yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin te ;
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ma rig pa nyid du mkhyen du zin kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la ma rig pa yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin te ;
translated: because even if the Tathagatas know ignorance to be ignorance, you accept that the Tathagata has ignorance.

original: dper na rab rib can rnams la skra shad la sogs pa snang ba dang nga la rab rib kyi dbang gis 'di mi bden pa snang ba yin no snyam du 'khrul par yongs su shes kyang 'khrul pa mi ldog pa yin la /
analyzed: dper na rab rib can rnams la skra shad la sogs pa snang ba dang nga la rab rib kyi dbang gis 'di mi bden pa snang ba yin no snyam du 'khrul par yongs su shes kyang 'khrul pa mi ldog pa yin la /
translated: For example, those who have eye disease see hairs and so on, and although they know that they are seeing something false because of the eye disease, the error is not eliminated.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang ngo //
translated: It is the same here.

original: de ltar na ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not reasonable to say that the BhagavƒÅn has abandoned the afflictions along with their traces.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams ma rig pa spong ba'i nus pa mnga' ru zin kyang bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje'i dbang gis ma rig pa mi spong ba yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams ma rig pa spong ba'i nus pa mnga' ru zin kyang bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje'i dbang gis ma rig pa mi spong ba yin te /
translated: Although the BhagavƒÅns have the ability to abandon ignorance, the BhagavƒÅns do not abandon ignorance because of their compassion.

original: gzhan du na chad par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzhan du na chad par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Otherwise, they would be nihilists.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs par gsungs pa ni spong bar nus pa mnga' ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs par gsungs pa ni spong bar nus pa mnga' ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The statement that the obscurations of affliction and the obscurations to omniscience are abandoned along with their propensities is made because they have the ability to abandon them.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,üîΩanother scripture says,

original: gzhan las / nyon mongs ma bsregs rtsa rtse bzhin //
analyzed: gzhan las / nyon mongs ma bsregs rtsa rtse bzhin //
translated: ‚ÄúThe afflictions are not burned like a root or a tip,

original: spangs pa nyid du mdzad pa yin ;üîΩ/ zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: spangs pa nyid du mdzad pa yin ; / zhes gsungs so //
translated: but are abandoned.

original: de ltar kha cig bcom ldan 'das la ye shes mnga' bar bzhed do //
analyzed: de ltar kha cig bcom ldan 'das la ye shes mnga' bar bzhed do //
translated: Thus some assert that the BhagavƒÅn possesses gnosis.

original: gzhan rnams kyis 'di ltar ston pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyis 'di ltar ston pa yin te /
translated: Others teach this:

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mtshan ma med cing rtsol pa med pa'i lam rab rib kyi mthar son pas ye shes kyi mtshan ma mi snang ba dang / sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas rang rig mi 'thad pa'i phyir ye shes ji ltar snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mtshan ma med cing rtsol pa med pa'i lam rab rib kyi mthar son pas ye shes kyi mtshan ma mi snang ba dang / sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas rang rig mi 'thad pa'i phyir ye shes ji ltar snang bar 'gyur /
translated: Since the BhagavƒÅns have reached the end of the obscurations of the path of signlessness and effortless, the signs of gnosis do not appear, and because it is not tenable that there is reflexive awareness, as was explained earlier, how could gnosis appear?

original: gzhan yang gal te chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams dmigs par bya ba yin na de'i tshe de dag la dmigs pa'i ye shes 'byung zhing snang bar 'gyur ba las 'on kyang sangs rgyas kyi sar dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byad pa dag phan tshun mnyam pa nyid
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams dmigs par bya ba yin na de'i tshe de dag la dmigs pa'i ye shes 'byung zhing snang bar 'gyur ba las 'on kyang sangs rgyas kyi sar dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byad pa dag phan tshun mnyam pa nyid
translated: However, on the level of buddhahood, the object of apprehension and the apprehender are mutually the same.

original: du gyur pas chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams dang ye shes rnams stong pa nyid dang ro gcig tu gyur pas ci ltar na ye shes @329a * //
analyzed: du gyur pas chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams dang ye shes rnams stong pa nyid dang ro gcig tu gyur pas ci ltar na ye shes @329a * //
translated: Since the extremely pure expanse of reality, the phenomena of dependent arising and wisdoms are of one taste in emptiness, how can wisdom

original: snang bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: snang bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //

original: gal te ye shes snang ba med na ci ltar chad par mi 'gyur zhing sems can gyi don ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ye shes snang ba med na ci ltar chad par mi 'gyur zhing sems can gyi don ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /

original: khyod kyi ye shes mi snang na chad par 'gyur zhes brjod pa de /üîΩbcom ldan 'das rnams chad par rtog gam ;
analyzed: khyod kyi ye shes mi snang na chad par 'gyur zhes brjod pa de / bcom ldan 'das rnams chad par rtog gam ;
translated: If your gnosis does not appear, it would be nihilistic.üîΩDo you, O Transcendent Lord, conceive of annihilation of the Buddha?üîΩOr do you conceive of annihilation of gnosis?

original: 'on te ye shes chad par rtog / de la bcom ldan 'das rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te ye shes chad par rtog / de la bcom ldan 'das rnams ni ma yin te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin can yin pas so //

original: chos kyi sku yang yon tan rnams dang ro gcig pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku yang yon tan rnams dang ro gcig pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa las /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa las /

analyzed: gang dag nga la gzugs su mthong //

original: gang dag nga la sgrar shes pa //
analyzed: gang dag nga la sgrar shes pa //
translated: and those who know me as sound,

analyzed: log par spong bar zhugs pa ste //

original: skye bo de dag nga mi mthong //
analyzed: skye bo de dag nga mi mthong //
translated: those people do not see me.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos nyid lta //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos nyid lta //
translated: The buddhas are to be seen as the truth;

original: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
analyzed: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
translated: the guides are the truth body.

original: chos nyid rig par bya min pas //
analyzed: chos nyid rig par bya min pas //
translated: The truth is not to be known,

original: des ni rnam par shes mi nus //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: des ni rnam par shes mi nus // zhes gsungs te /
translated: so it cannot be known.üîΩThe meaning of this is as follows.

original: 'di'i don ni gang gzugs kyi sku mthong ba tsam gyis sam /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gang gzugs kyi sku mthong ba tsam gyis sam /
translated: Those who see the form body alone, or

original: sgra rjes su mthong ba tsam gyis kho bos de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: sgra rjes su mthong ba tsam gyis kho bos de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngo //

original: shes so snyam du sems can de rnams ni sangs rgyas mthong ba la gegs byed pa'i las kyi sgrib pa spong ba'i don du log par zhugs pa yin te de nyid las gus par zhugs pas de rnams kyis nga mthong ba ma yin zhing phyis kyang mthong barüîΩmi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: shes so snyam du sems can de rnams ni sangs rgyas mthong ba la gegs byed pa'i las kyi sgrib pa spong ba'i don du log par zhugs pa yin te de nyid las gus par zhugs pas de rnams kyis nga mthong ba ma yin zhing phyis kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because of their lack of respect, they do not see me now, nor will they see me in the future.

original: gal te gzugs kyi spu mthong ba tsam gyis sangs rgyas mthong bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te gzugs kyi spu mthong ba tsam gyis sangs rgyas mthong bar mi 'gyur gyi /

analyzed: 'di de mthong ba dang rjes su mthun pa yin no snyam du sems na /

original: de'i tshe nga mthong bar 'gyur ba yin gyi gang gi tshe ma mthong ba mngon par zhen pa yod na ni de'i tshe ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nga mthong bar 'gyur ba yin gyi gang gi tshe ma mthong ba mngon par zhen pa yod na ni de'i tshe ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur ro //

original: de'i chos nyid mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid sangs rgyas mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i chos nyid mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid sangs rgyas mthong ba yin te /
translated: Seeing his reality is seeing the Buddha.

original: de de dang ro gcig pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de de dang ro gcig pa yin pas so //
translated: because it is of one taste with that.

original: chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin chos nyid de yang gzugs mthong ba dang / sgra thos pa tsam gyis so so'i skye bos khong du chud par mi nus so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin chos nyid de yang gzugs mthong ba dang / sgra thos pa tsam gyis so so'i skye bos khong du chud par mi nus so //
translated: Moreover, that reality which is the nature of the Dharma Body cannot be comprehended by ordinary folk merely by seeing forms and hearing sounds.

original: don dam par ni yongs su dag pas kyang ma yin na shes pa dang shes bya dag nub par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: don dam par ni yongs su dag pas kyang ma yin na shes pa dang shes bya dag nub par 'gyur bas so //
translated: In the ultimate sense, it is not even comprehended by the completely purified, because the extinction of both the knower and the known occurs.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: des na / sangs rgyas rnams ni chos nyid lta //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: des na / sangs rgyas rnams ni chos nyid lta // zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: chos thams cad ma mthong ba nyid kyang sangs rgyas mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ma mthong ba nyid kyang sangs rgyas mthong ba'o //
translated: The non-seeing of all things is the seeing of the Buddha.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan @329b las kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan @329b las kyang /
translated: For this very reason, it is said elsewhere:

original: thams cad la ni khyad med kyang //
analyzed: thams cad la ni khyad med kyang //
translated: Although there is no difference in the ultimate,

original: de bzhin nyid dag gyur pa la //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dag gyur pa la //
translated: the purification of reality

original: de bzhin gshegs brjod de yi phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs brjod de yi phyir //
translated: is called the Tathagata.

original: las can thams cad de snying can //
analyzed: las can thams cad de snying can //
translated: Therefore, all those who have karma

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: have the essence of that.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das rnams chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin can yin pas chad par 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das rnams chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin can yin pas chad par 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because the Blessed Ones have the nature of the Dharma Body, they do not undergo annihilation.

original: gal te ye shes chad par rtog na de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te ye shes chad par rtog na de yang mi rigs te /
translated: If you imagine that pristine wisdom is annihilated, that also is illogical.

original: de chad kyang bcom ldan 'das rnams chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin can yin pas chad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de chad kyang bcom ldan 'das rnams chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin can yin pas chad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if it were annihilated, the Transcendent Lords are of the nature of the Truth Body, and so there is no annihilation.

original: kho bo cag la ci zhig gnod par 'gyur /
analyzed: kho bo cag la ci zhig gnod par 'gyur /
translated: What harm would that be to us?

original: gzhan yang ye shes la dang por rang bzhin yod par 'gyur na de phyis chad pa las chad par smra bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang ye shes la dang por rang bzhin yod par 'gyur na de phyis chad pa las chad par smra bar 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, if pristine wisdom were to exist essentially in the beginning, then later it would be annihilated, and you would be advocating annihilation.

original: 'on kyang thog ma nas kyang de la rang bzhin med pa'i phyir gang zhig chad par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on kyang thog ma nas kyang de la rang bzhin med pa'i phyir gang zhig chad par 'gyur /
translated: However, since it is essenceless from the beginning, what is there to be annihilated?

original: de skad du yang /üîΩ'di la dor ba ci zhig yod //
analyzed: de skad du yang / 'di la dor ba ci zhig yod //
translated: As it has been said:üîΩWhat is there to be removed from this?

original: 'di la bsnan pa ci yang med //üîΩyang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
analyzed: 'di la bsnan pa ci yang med // yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
translated: What is there to be added to this?üîΩSee the truth in truth.

original: yang dag mthong nas rnam par grol //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag mthong nas rnam par grol // zhes gsungs so //
translated: When you see the truth, you are liberated.

original: des na ye shes la chad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ye shes la chad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, pristine wisdom is not annihilated.

original: sems can gyi don yang chad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi don yang chad pa ma yin te /
translated: The welfare of sentient beings is also not annihilated.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i skus 'gro ba'i don rdzogs par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i skus 'gro ba'i don rdzogs par mdzad pas so //
translated: And the enjoyment body and emanation body accomplish the welfare of living beings.

original: de yang phyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de yang phyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba'i nus pa mnga' bas bcom ldan 'das rnams bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs par 'jog la /
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba'i nus pa mnga' bas bcom ldan 'das rnams bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs par 'jog la /
translated: The Bhagavans are posited as having abandoned the afflictions and the obscurations to omniscience together with their imprints because they possess the ability to abandon the afflictions and the obscurations to omniscience together with their imprints.üîΩBut the Bhagavans have not abandoned them in every way, and the Bhagavans have not abandoned ignorance through the power of compassion.

original: rnam pa thams cad du ma spangs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis snying rje'i stobs kyis ma rig pa bzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba de gang las gsungs /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du ma spangs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis snying rje'i stobs kyis ma rig pa bzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba de gang las gsungs /

original: nyon mongs ma bsregs zhes bya ba la sogs pa de mdzad pa'i tshig yin gyi don mdo las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs ma bsregs zhes bya ba la sogs pa de mdzad pa'i tshig yin gyi don mdo las ni ma yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe afflictions are not burned‚Äù and so on is a statement of the activity of the Bhagavans, not the meaning of the sutra.

original: yang na 'di'i don ni khyed kyis nyon mongs pa ma bsregs te /
analyzed: yang na 'di'i don ni khyed kyis nyon mongs pa ma bsregs te /
translated: Or the meaning of this is as follows: You have not burned the afflictions.

original: zhig par mdzad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhig par mdzad pa ma yin te /
translated: You have not made them cease.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams la rang bzhin med pas so//
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams la rang bzhin med pas so//
translated: Because the afflictions have no intrinsic reality.

original: 'on kyang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin med par thugs su chud pas rtsva'i rtse mo bzhin du spong bar mdzad pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin med par thugs su chud pas rtsva'i rtse mo bzhin du spong bar mdzad pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: However, because he has realized that the afflictions have no intrinsic reality, he abandons them like the tip of a blade of grass.

original: des na 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das la ye shes lnga'i rnam gzhag byas pa gang yin pa de ni ji ltar rigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das la ye shes lnga'i rnam gzhag byas pa gang yin pa de ni ji ltar rigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: If the five kinds of gnosis are ascribed to the Lord, how is that reasonable?

original: @330a * // de la lan bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: @330a * // de la lan bstan par bya ste /
translated: The answer to that is as follows.

original: gang gi tshe chos kyi sku'i dbang gis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku dag las sngon gyi smon lam dang sems can rnams kyi bsod nams kyi dbang gis gdul bya rnams la ye shes lnga dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston pa'i snang ba 'byung bar 'gyur la /

translated: When, by the power of the body of truth, the enjoyment body and emanation body appear to those to be trained by the power of former aspirations and the merit of sentient beings, the appearance of the teaching of the Dharma that is consistent with the five kinds of gnosis arises.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das rnams chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes mnga' ba yin no zhes gdul bya rnams kyis yongs su rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das rnams chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes mnga' ba yin no zhes gdul bya rnams kyis yongs su rtog pa yin te /

analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston par gyur pa ste /

analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das la chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes mnga' ba yin no zhes yongs su rtog pa yin no //
translated: at that time they think, ‚ÄúThe Bhagavat possesses the pristine wisdom of the extremely pure dharmadhatu.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe sems can dang cig shos la sogs pa'i dngos po yongs su shes par ston par snang bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das la me long lta bu'i ye shes mnga' ba yin no zhes yongs su rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems can dang cig shos la sogs pa'i dngos po yongs su shes par ston par snang bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das la me long lta bu'i ye shes mnga' ba yin no zhes yongs su rtog pa yin no //
translated: When he appears to teach the knowledge of the entities of sentient beings and so on, at that time they think, ‚ÄúThe Bhagavat possesses mirror-like pristine wisdom.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid la sogs par ston par snang bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes mnga' ba yin no zhes yongs su rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid la sogs par ston par snang bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes mnga' ba yin no zhes yongs su rtog pa yin no //
translated: When he appears to teach the equality of self and others, then he is considered to have the gnosis of equality.

original: gang gi tshe sems can gyi spyod pa la sogs pa ston par snang bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das la so sor rtog pa'i ye shes mnga' ba nyid yin no zhes yongs su rtog pa yin no //

translated: When he appears to teach the conduct of sentient beings, then he is considered to have the individually discerning gnosis.

original: gang gi tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod pa'i gnyen po'i chos ston par snang bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das la bya ba grub pa'i ye shes mnga' ba yin no zhes yongs su rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod pa'i gnyen po'i chos ston par snang bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das la bya ba grub pa'i ye shes mnga' ba yin no zhes yongs su rtog pa yin no //
translated: When he appears to teach the Dharma that is the antidote to the conduct of attachment and so on, then he is considered to have the gnosis of successful activities.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das la chos kyi sku'i rgyu can ye shes rnam pa lnga mnga' ba yin pas ye shes rgyun chad par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //

original: de ltar yang mdo sde rgyan las /

translated: there is no single buddha, nor many buddhas.

analyzed: /'di'i don ni sangs rgyas gcig nyid du yang 'dod pa ma yin te /
